meta.description:
Label Generation Rules for the Bosnian language using the Latin script

Overview

This document specifies a reference set of Label Generation Rules for Bosnian-Latin using a limited repertoire as appropriate for a second level domain.

Repertoire

All references converge on 31 (27+4) Latin code points.

There is no IDN table published in the IANA Repository of IDN Practices by .ba ccTLD

Because the formal differentiation of Bosnian from the other languages of former Yugoslavia is so recent, and its Latin writing system has not added any letters, older refrences for Latin character use are still applicable.

Excluded code points

None.

Extended code points

None.

The four letters 'q', 'w', 'x' and 'y' are not part of the core alphabet for Bosnian. However, they are included here as part of the core repertoire because of their use in representing foreign words, brand names and other common uses such as "www" in domain names.

Variants

None.

Character Classes

This LGR defines no named character classes.

Rules

Common rules only:

  • Hyphen Restrictions — restrictions on the allowable placement of hyphens (no leading/ending hyphen and no hyphen in positions 3 and 4). These restrictions are described in section 4.2.3.1 of RFC5891 [120]. They are implemented here as context rule on U+002D (-) HYPHEN-MINUS.

  • Leading Combining Marks — restrictions on the allowable placement of combining marks (no leading combining mark). This rule is described in section 4.2.3.2 of RFC5891 [120].

Actions

Actions included are the default actions for LGRs as well as those needed to invalidate labels with misplaced combining marks.

Methodology and Contributors

This reference LGR for Bosnian-Latin for the 2nd Level has been developed by Michel Suignard and Asmus Freytag, verified in expert reviews by Michael Everson, Nicholas Ostler, and Wil Tan, and based on multiple open public consultations.

References

General references for the language:

  • Uzicanin, Nikolina. 1996. Hippocrene compact dictionary: Bosnian-English English-Bosnian. New York: Hippocrene Books. ISBN 0-7818-0499-X
  • Wikipedia: "Gaj's Latin alphabet", http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaj%27s_Latin_alphabet
  • Omniglot: "Bosnian (bosanski)" http://www.omniglot.com/writing/bosnian.htm

In the listing of the repertoire by code point, references starting from [0] refer to the version of the Unicode Standard in which the corresponding code point was initially encoded. Other references (starting from [100]) document usage of code points. For more details, see the Table of References below.

reference.comment: Code points cited were originally encoded in Unicode Version 1.1

references.reference: The Unicode Consortium. The Unicode Standard, Version 6.3.0, (Mountain View, CA: The Unicode Consortium, 2013. ISBN 978-1-936213-08-5) http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.3.0/

Internetstiftelsen i Sverige (IIS), "IDN Reference table for Bosnian language based on Latin script" https://github.com/dotse/IDN-ref-tables/blob/master/language-tables/bosnian-lang-Latin-based-ref-table.txt
RFC5891, Internationalized Domain Names in Applications (IDNA): Protocol http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5891

reference.comment: This table lists only the characters outside the set a-z. Code points cited are for Croatian

references.reference: ISO/IEC 6937 Third Ed. 2001-12-17- Information technology — Coded graphic character set for text communication — Latin alphabet: Table D.1 (p 35) Use of Latin alphabetic characters.

reference.comment: Code points cited form the standard set

references.reference: Everson, Michael, The Alphabets of Europe: "Bosnian" http://www.evertype.com/alphabets/bosnian.pdf

reference.comment: Code points cited are from an extended set

references.reference: Everson, Michael. The Alphabets of Europe: "Bosnian" http://www.evertype.com/alphabets/bosnian.pdf

reference.comment: Code points cited are from the set of Main Letters

references.reference: The Unicode Consortium, Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) Version 28 (2015-09-16) - Locale Data Summary for Bosnian [bs] http://www.unicode.org/cldr/charts/28/summary/bs.html

reference.comment: Code points cited are from the Auxiliary set

references.reference: The Unicode Consortium, Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) Version 28 (2015-09-16) - Locale Data Summary for Bosnian [bs] http://www.unicode.org/cldr/charts/28/summary/bs.html

reference.comment: Code points cited are omitted from the basic Latin set A-Z according to the table.

references.reference: Table "Reduced usage of the letters of the ISO Basic Latin alphabet (A-Z) in various alphabets " in Wikipedia: "Latin alphabets" https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latin_alphabets

reference.comment: Code points cited from the basic set from A-Z are included in the alphabet according to the table.

references.reference: Table "Reduced usage of the letters of the ISO Basic Latin alphabet (A-Z) in various alphabets " in Wikipedia: "Latin alphabets" https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latin_alphabets

reference.comment: Code points cited are supported in a national edition of ISO-646.

references.reference: Edition for YU (Yugoslavia) of ISO/IEC 646:1991 — Information technology — ISO 7-bit coded character set for information interchange

reference.comment: The table only lists code points beyond A-Z

char.comment: LATIN SMALL LETTER C WITH ACUTE
LATIN SMALL LETTER C WITH CARON
LATIN SMALL LETTER D WITH STROKE
LATIN SMALL LETTER S WITH CARON
LATIN SMALL LETTER Z WITH CARON

rule.name: leading-combining-mark
rule.comment: RFC5891 restrictions on placement of combining marks

rule.name: hyphen-minus-disallowed
rule.comment: RFC5891 restrictions on placement of U+002D
no consecutive hyphens in third and fourth

rule.name: extended-cp
rule.comment: code points from the extended range

action.comment: by default, labels with leading combining marks are invalid
